projectPurpose: To provide a simple, fast, and efficient command-line interface (CLI) tool for interacting with APIs, serving as a terminal-based alternative to graphical API clients.

alternatives.name: Postman
mainFeatures: Extensive testing tools (client, design, documentation, testing, mock servers)

alternatives.name: Insomnia
mainFeatures: Supports multiple protocols (REST, GraphQL, gRPC, SOAP, WebSockets)
Collaboration features with Cloud, Local, and Git sync

alternatives.name: cURL
mainFeatures: Supports numerous protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, etc.)
Widely used for scripting and automation

alternatives.name: HTTPie
alternatives.license: Open Source (BSD License) for CLI, Proprietary for Desktop/Web

alternatives.name: Bruno
mainFeatures: Uses a plain text markup language (Bru)
No accounts or cloud sync required

marketPositioning: ATAC is positioned as a fast, efficient, and privacy-focused terminal-based API client, offering a 'Postman-like' experience without the need for a graphical interface, accounts, or cloud synchronization. It competes directly with other CLI API tools like cURL and HTTPie, differentiating itself by providing a more interactive and feature-rich environment within the terminal, built with Rust for performance.
